acceptance_tests: Tetrominoes spawn, fall, and can be moved and rotated according to Tetris rules
Completed horizontal lines are removed and remaining blocks fall correctly
Score and level update accurately based on lines cleared
Game ends when new tetrominoes can no longer enter the playfield
Game loop runs without logical or rendering deadlocks

constraints.maintainability: Architecture must be modular and extensible
constraints.performance: Must support real-time gameplay with consistent frame updates

goal: Design and specify a complete, production-ready architecture for a new implementation of the game Tetris, covering core gameplay, systems, and extensibility.
recommendations: Document all core systems with diagrams for long-term maintainability
Design the architecture to support both single-player and future multiplayer modes
Consider testability by isolating game logic from rendering and input

can: Include sound effects and music hooks
Support multiple visual themes or skins
Add optional game modes beyond classic Tetris
Provide hooks for analytics or telemetry
Support replay or ghost piece visualization
must: Implement core Tetris gameplay with a grid-based playfield
Support all standard tetromino shapes with correct rotation rules
Implement gravity, player-controlled movement, and hard/soft drops
Detect line completion and remove completed lines correctly
Maintain and display score, level, and line count
Handle game over conditions when the playfield overflows
Define a clear game loop and state management model
should: Use a deterministic randomization system for tetromino generation (e.g., bag system)
Support increasing difficulty as levels progress
Separate rendering, game logic, and input handling layers
Provide a clean API or module boundaries for future enhancements
